poem:
Title: The Birth Pangs of Prosperity

From industries' crucible, a phoenix stirs,
Smoky fracture of hope yawns wide in the January freeze.
Just 0.2 yet it quickens the nation's pulse,
A modest rise, yet mighty in its promise.
In the bare wreck of recession, a tender sprout,
Unfurling in the biting air of frosty britain.
O grey-faced economists, smile! A seedling thrives,
Surviving in the rubble of our times.
